alert.note: Alert for Berkshire; Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:07PM EST until December 18 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Deerfield At Charlemont affecting Franklin and Berkshire Counties. ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Massachusetts... West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Deerfield at Charlemont. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, In Charlemont, floodwaters inundate lowest lying farmland adjacent to the Deerfield River. Floodwaters inundate the lowest lying roadway in the Mohawk park Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.7 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 04/03/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
